title: 108_hr3412
content: The Act titled "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2003" expands the deduction for interest on education loans. The "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2003" expands the deduction for interest on education loans by repealing the dollar limitation and increasing the phaseout beginning point based on modified adjusted gross income. The "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2003" expands the deduction for interest on education loans by repealing the dollar limitation and increasing the phaseout beginning point based on modified adjusted gross income. The amendment also adjusts the $100,000 and $200,000 amounts in subsection (b) for taxable years after 2004. The amendment increases the cost-of-living adjustment for taxable years starting after December 31, 2003. SEC. 3. Deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses made permanent. Repeal of termination of Section 222 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Conforming amendments to apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2003. SEC. 4. Education savings accounts. SEC. 4. EDUCATION SAVINGS ACCOUNTS. Increase in allowable contributions to $5,000. Reports must be filed by June 30 of the following year. Effective for taxable years after December 31, 2003. SEC. 5. Allowance of room, board, and special needs services for scholarships and tuition reduction programs in higher education. In amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, qualified scholarship definitions are expanded to include qualified higher education expenses for enrollment at eligible educational institutions. The terms 'qualified higher education expenses' and 'eligible educational institution' are defined in section 529(e). Additionally, adjustments are made to tuition reduction programs under special rules for teaching and research assistants. The amendments made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 include expanding qualified scholarship definitions to cover qualified higher education expenses at eligible educational institutions. These changes also involve adjustments to tuition reduction programs for teaching and research assistants. The effective date for these amendments is after December 31, 2003, for education provided in academic periods starting after that date. SEC. 6. Treatment of prepayment and savings plans in student financial aid needs analysis. The amendment defines qualified education benefits as not being considered assets for students under section 475 of the Higher Education Act of 1965. Qualified education benefits include programs described in section 529(b)(1)(A) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendment modifies the definition of qualified education benefits under the Higher Education Act of 1965 to include programs under section 529(b)(1)(A) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and Coverdell education savings accounts. It also amends the definition of other financial assistance under the Act. The effective date for these amendments is for academic years starting on or after July 1, 2005. SEC. 7. REPEAL OF EGTRRA SUNSET APPLICABILITY TO CERTAIN EDUCATION PROVISIONS. Title IX of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 will not apply to subtitles A, B, and D of title IV of the Act.
